Class Grid

java.lang.Object
Grid
public class Grid
extends Object
Grid class creates a two dimensional array of squares

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Grid.Status
    Status is an enumerated type

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Square[][] grid  
    private int height  
    private int numMines  
    private int numSquaresUncovered  
    private int width  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Grid​(int w, int h, int numMines)
    Constructor that fills the grid with numbersquares and minesquares

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void exposeMines()
    exposeMines uncovers all the mines on the board
    void fillGrid()
    fillGrid starts by putting mines in random locations then it fills the remaining squares with number squares with their coresponding neighbormines
    void flagSquare​(int r, int c)
    flagSquare changes the element of a square to F
    int getNeighbors​(int r, int c)
    getNeighbors returns the number of mines around a square
    void recursiveUncover​(int r, int c)
    recursiveUncover uncovers every square with no neighbor until it reachs either a mine or a square with neighbors
    String toString()
    toString returns the board printed in a grid style
    Grid.Status uncoverSquare​(int r, int c)
    uncoverSquare uncovers a square and checks whether it is a mine or a square with neighbors and then uncovers just that square and returns the appropiate status.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid​(int w, int h, int numMines)
      Constructor that fills the grid with numbersquares and minesquares
      Parameters:
      w - the width
      h - the height
      numMines - the number of mines

  • Method Details

    • fillGrid

      public void fillGrid()
      fillGrid starts by putting mines in random locations then it fills the remaining squares with number squares with their coresponding neighbormines

    • getNeighbors

      public int getNeighbors​(int r, int c)
      getNeighbors returns the number of mines around a square
      Parameters:
      r - the row number
      c - the column number
      Returns:
      number of neighbors

    • recursiveUncover

      public void recursiveUncover​(int r, int c)
      recursiveUncover uncovers every square with no neighbor until it reachs either a mine or a square with neighbors
      Parameters:
      r - the row number
      c - the column number

    • uncoverSquare

      public Grid.Status uncoverSquare​(int r, int c)
      uncoverSquare uncovers a square and checks whether it is a mine or a square with neighbors and then uncovers just that square and returns the appropiate status. However, if the square has no neighbors it calls the recursive uncover function
      Parameters:
      r - the row number
      c - the column number
      Returns:
      the condition (Win, Lose, Okay)

    • exposeMines

      public void exposeMines()
      exposeMines uncovers all the mines on the board

    • flagSquare

      public void flagSquare​(int r, int c)
      flagSquare changes the element of a square to F
      Parameters:
      r - the row number
      c - the column number

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString returns the board printed in a grid style
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
